educationBG.title: Web Full-Stack Developer
educationBG.description:
Activities and Societies:
- FullStack Development
- Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Laravel, Eloquent, MySQL, OOP, Git
- Agile Methodologies: Scrum
- MVC Architecture Pattern
- MySQL Workbench
- Text Editors: Atom / VSCode

During my academic journey, I actively participated in FullStack development activities and societies. Here's a breakdown of my involvement:

1. Technology Stack: I gained proficiency in various technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Laravel, Eloquent, MySQL, OOP, and Git. These skills formed the foundation of my FullStack development expertise.

2. Agile Methodologies: I was introduced to Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum, which emphasized collaborative and iterative development processes.

3. MVC Architecture: I applied the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture pattern to develop efficient and organized web applications.

4. Database Management: I utilized MySQL Workbench for designing and managing relational databases, ensuring data integrity and efficiency.

5. Text Editors: I worked with popular text editors like Atom and Visual Studio Code, enhancing my coding efficiency.

Additionally, I had the opportunity to work on a significant project:

- Project: Social Network Web Application
  - Front-End: I developed the user interface using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create a responsive and user-friendly design.
  - Back-End: I implemented the REST API and server-side logic using PHP, with Laravel as a supporting framework, following best practices in MVC architecture.
  - Database Design: I designed the relational database using UML, facilitating efficient data interactions with MySQL.
  - Version Control: The project was managed using Git for version control in a collaborative and organized manner within a private repository.

My academic journey equipped me with valuable skills and experiences in FullStack development, agile methodologies, and effective project management.

educationBG.title: Project Manager & UX/UI Design
educationBG.description:
Product Manager, Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Disciplines, Grade: 9

During this course, I gained in-depth knowledge of various aspects of product management, including:

- Mission, Vision, and Purpose
- Problem Identification
- Exploring Different Points Of View (POV)
- Defining a Unique Value Proposition
- Creating a Project Brief
- Designing a Client Persona
- Conducting Market Research
- Defining a Business Model
- Performing a SWOT Analysis
- Calculating Market Volume
- Crafting a Differentiation Strategy
- Developing a Positioning Map Relative to Competitors
- Creating a Minimum Viable Product (MVP)
- Defining a Development Roadmap

Throughout the course, I had the opportunity to apply these skills in project development and strategic decision-making.

educationBG.title: Smart Contract Development
educationBG.description:
Covering various aspects of Solidity development and diverse tools for crafting decentralized applications.

These include:

Fundamentals of Solidity development
Chainlink and decentralized oracles
Truffle and oracle creation
zkSync
